zh: 强盗从树后出来袭击了他。

en: It was very windy.
zh: 风很大。

en: When you want cooperation, share the responsibility.
zh: 想要合作，就要分担责任。

en: The fingerprints left on the weapon match the suspect's.
zh: 留在武器上的指纹与嫌疑人的指纹相符。

en: I'm really happy because I won 10,000 yen at the horse races.
zh: 我真高兴，因为我在赛马中赢了1万日元。

en: Competition isn't bad in itself.
zh: 竞争本身并没有什么不好。

en: Kyoto is not as big as Osaka.
zh: 京都没有大阪大。

en: Kyoto is the most beautiful in the autumn.
zh: 秋天的京都是最美的。

en: Kyoto is most crowded when it is extremely beautiful.
zh: 京都最美的时候也是人最多的时候。

en: You don't want to make me angry.
zh: 你不会想惹我生气的。

en: The people look like trash from here.
zh: 从这里看，那些人就像垃圾一样。

en: There is only one truth!
zh: 真相只有一个！

en: Money is heavier than life.
zh: 金钱比生命更重要。

en: You're the first! ... Little idiots to have made a fool of me.
zh: 你是第一个！... 敢愚弄我的小笨蛋们。

en: The 456 billion dollars spent in the Iraq war could provide one year's free education for every child in the world.
zh: 伊拉克战争花费的4560亿美元可以为世界上每个孩子提供一年的免费教育。

en: I was surprised to come across vending machines that sell cans of coffee, where you can even choose between hot and cold ones.
zh: 我很惊讶地发现有卖罐装咖啡的自动售货机，你甚至可以选择热的还是冷的。

en: The thing that most surprised me since coming to Japan is how many vending machines there are.
zh: 自从来到日本，最让我惊讶的是自动售货机竟然这么多。

en: I wonder if that country is actually really ready to accept a black president.
zh: 我怀疑那个国家是否真的准备好接受一位黑人总统。

en: Having reached the rank of prime minister, and with the enthusiastic support of the masses, it seems he is able to wield presidential powers.
zh: 他已经达到了总理的职位，并且得到了群众的热情支持，看来他能够行使总统的权力。

en: It seems that we're becoming more right-wing all over the world.
zh: 看来我们全世界都在变得更加右倾。

en: Fish stocks are declining due to over-protection of whales, so fish that whales can eat should also be protected.
zh: 由于过度保护鲸鱼，鱼类资源正在减少，所以也应该保护鲸鱼可以吃的鱼。

en: Holding the Olympics where there's severe atmospheric pollution gives rise to a great risk for athletes.
zh: 在空气污染严重的地方举办奥运会，对运动员来说风险很大。

en: It looks like most people give up before realizing their abilities.
zh: 看起来大多数人在意识到自己的能力之前就放弃了。

en: Stories like Cinderella can be found in China, Japan and in every land of the world.
zh: 像灰姑娘这样的故事在中国、日本和世界上的每个地方都能找到。

en: Very regrettably, 1,900 square meters of land become desert every second.
zh: 非常遗憾的是，每秒钟有1900平方米的土地变成沙漠。

en: While there are some people who use the Internet to learn foreign languages, there are others, living on less than a dollar a day, who cannot even read their own language.
zh: 虽然有些人利用互联网学习外语，但还有一些人，每天的生活费不足一美元，甚至无法阅读自己的语言。

en: Miracles are called miracles because they don't happen!
zh: 奇迹之所以被称为奇迹，是因为它们不会发生！

en: Around half of middle-school students in Japan have mobile phones, but if you look at those in high school then 97% have them.
zh: 在日本，大约一半的初中生拥有手机，但如果你看看高中生，那么97%的人都拥有手机。

en: It's very interesting that in Chinese the concept of tense does not exist.
zh: 非常有趣的是，在中文里，时态的概念是不存在的。

en: ... reason? What you're looking for is a pretext, isn't it?
zh: ……理由？你想要的是借口，不是吗？

en: Eternity exists. It exists here...
zh: 永恒存在。它就在这里……

en: I hate people who say that.
zh: 我讨厌说这种话的人。

en: You're not just peddling stuff!
zh: 你不仅仅是在兜售东西！

en: The world around you is ... just a little kinder ... even more than you think.
zh: 你周围的世界……比你想象的还要更友善一点……

en: Sorrrry. I couldn't sleep last night, and so I overslept. Teehee!
zh: 对不起。我昨晚没睡好，所以睡过头了。嘻嘻！

en: It says girls born under Cancer are 'daring'.
zh: 上面说巨蟹座出生的女孩是“大胆的”。

en: Don't talk ... as if you know what it's like...
zh: 别说得……好像你知道那是什么滋味一样……

en: I have no interest in ordinary people.
zh: 我对普通人没有兴趣。

en: Do you know the name of the most successful military man from this area?
zh: 你知道这个地区最成功的军事家的名字吗？

en: In other words, you should doubt common sense.
zh: 换句话说，你应该怀疑常识。

en: I'll take that as a compliment.
zh: 我就当这是夸奖了。

en: Even Japanese people make mistakes using the prefixes 'o' and 'go'.
zh: 即使是日本人也会犯使用“お”和“ご”前缀的错误。

en: There are many places you should see in Kyoto.
zh: 在京都，有很多值得一看的地方。

en: I'm not good at fishing.
zh: 我不擅长钓鱼。

en: I prefer staying at home to going fishing.
zh: 比起去钓鱼，我更喜欢待在家里。

en: I'd rather stay home than go fishing.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不愿去钓鱼。

en: I'd rather stay at home than go fishing.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不愿去钓鱼。

en: Suicide is a leading cause of death in the country with the longest life expectancy.
zh: 在预期寿命最长的国家，自杀是主要的死亡原因之一。

en: Things like grammars that can be called absolutely correct do not exist anywhere.
zh: 像语法这样可以被称为绝对正确的东西在任何地方都不存在。

en: In the sea, there are as many fish as you like.
zh: 在海里，鱼多的是。

en: There are a lot of fish in the sea.
zh: 海里有很多鱼。

en: How many times do you feed the fish?
zh: 你一天喂鱼几次？

en: Don't just eat fish. Eat some meat, too.
zh: 别光吃鱼，也吃点肉。

en: Don't just eat fish. Eat meat, too.
zh: 别光吃鱼，也吃点肉。

en: I wonder if the sea level really will rise when the ice at the North Pole melts.
zh: 我不知道北极的冰融化后，海平面是否真的会上升。

en: Despite being fascinated with English, many Japanese don't even try to study it.
zh: 尽管对英语很着迷，但许多日本人甚至都不尝试学习它。

en: Fires for luring fish at night flicker on the silhouette of an island.
zh: 在岛屿的轮廓上，夜间引诱鱼的火光闪烁着。

en: Doesn't he just get on your nerves?
zh: 他是不是很让你心烦？

en: In the name of the moon, we'll punish you!
zh: 我代表月亮消灭你！

en: Don't enter the room without permission.
zh: 未经允许，请勿进入房间。

zh: 谢谢你允许我。

en: Don't enter this room without permission.
zh: 未经允许，请勿进入此房间。

en: You cannot take pictures in the theater without permission.
zh: 未经允许，您不能在剧院拍照。

en: If nobody knows what's coming next, nobody will be disappointed.
zh: 如果没人知道接下来会发生什么，就不会有人失望。

en: When I was playing video games in the living room, my mom asked me if I would go shopping with her.
zh: 当我在客厅玩电子游戏时，我妈妈问我是否愿意和她一起去购物。

en: Last year I suffered from an inflammation of my middle ear.
zh: 去年我得了中耳炎。

en: I gave birth to my first child last year.

en: I took a handicraft course last year.
zh: 我去年上了一个手工艺课程。

en: I didn't think I wanted to do it again, given that I failed last year.
zh: 鉴于我去年失败了，我不想再做一次了。

en: Mr. Brown took charge of this class last year.
zh: 布朗先生去年负责这个班级。

en: It snowed a lot last year.
zh: 去年下了很大的雪。

zh: 去年下了很多雪。

en: Last summer, I worked part time on a farm.
zh: 去年夏天，我在农场做兼职。

en: Last year in the summer I worked part-time on a farm.
zh: 去年夏天我在农场做兼职。

en: That looked like Mr. Tanaka, but actually it was a shoebox.
zh: 那看起来像田中先生，但实际上是一个鞋盒。

en: I'm saying "For the sake of Earth's environment," but actually it's "For the sake of the people living on Earth."
zh: 我说的是“为了地球环境”，但实际上是“为了生活在地球上的人们”。

en: If you turned off your computer right now, you would contribute to the prevention of global warming.
zh: 如果你现在关掉你的电脑，你将有助于防止全球变暖。

en: Godzilla will never ever destroy the Imperial Palace nor the signboards of the sponsoring companies.
zh: 哥斯拉永远不会摧毁皇宫或赞助公司的招牌。

en: Repeating a mistake without recognizing it as one, is the biggest mistake of all.
zh: 重复一个错误而不认识到它是一个错误，是最大的错误。

en: I traveled to Italy last summer.
zh: 去年夏天我去意大利旅行了。

zh: 与去年夏天相比，今年的雨水不多。

en: Compared to last summer, we haven't had so much rain this year.
zh: 与去年夏天相比，今年我们没有下那么多雨。

en: Milk is nutritious.
zh: 牛奶很有营养。

en: Someday I'll buy a cotton candy machine.
zh: 总有一天我会买一台棉花糖机。

en: Have you eaten a banana pie?

en: Do you have any preference between beef and lamb?

en: And then, he chased the cattle, the sheep and everyone out of the temple.
zh: 然后，他把牛、羊和所有人都赶出了圣殿。

en: You should not despise a man just because he is poorly paid.
zh: 你不应该因为一个人收入低就轻视他。

en: Do you have school lunch?
zh: 你们有学校午餐吗？

en: The income tax rate increases in proportion to the salary increase.
zh: 所得税率随着工资的增加而增加。

en: I don't know whether I should laugh or cry.
zh: 我不知道我应该笑还是哭。

en: Please call an ambulance.
zh: 请叫一辆救护车。

en: Call an ambulance!

en: Urgent business kept me from coming sooner.
zh: 紧急事务耽误了我，没能早点来。

en: Because some urgent business came up, he wasn't able to go to the concert.
zh: 因为有些紧急的事情，他没能去听音乐会。

en: The express train went by so fast we hardly saw it.
zh: 特快列车开得太快了，我们几乎没看到。

en: I am a very sad person.
zh: 我是一个非常悲伤的人。

en: I am a lonely man.
zh: 我是一个孤独的男人。

en: I have recklessness in my blood. Since the time I was a child, I've only managed to hurt myself.
zh: 我的血液里流淌着鲁莽。 从我还是个孩子的时候起，我就只会伤害自己。

zh: 从现在开始，你将成为世界上最强的十五岁少年。

en: The train came out of the long tunnel forming the border, and there was the snow country.
zh: 火车驶出形成国境的漫长隧道，那里就是雪国。

zh: 我突然想念我的手表了。

en: Suddenly it began to rain.
zh: 突然开始下雨了。

en: Suddenly, the basement I was in started to look almost nice and warm.
zh: 突然，我所在的地下室看起来几乎变得漂亮和温暖起来。

en: If you hurry you'll be in time for the train.
zh: 如果你快点，你就能赶上火车。

en: The more hurry, the less speed.
zh: 欲速则不达。

en: Hurry. Please lend me a hand.
zh: 快点。请帮我一把。

en: Hurry up! If you don't, we'll be late.
zh: 快点！如果你不快点，我们就要迟到了。

zh: 似乎没有必要着急。

zh: 不用着急。

en: Let's hurry.
zh: 我们快点吧。

zh: 快点，不然你要迟到了。

zh: 如果你不快点，你就要迟到了。

en: I couldn't believe what I was seeing.
zh: 我简直不敢相信我所看到的。

en: You need to bear in mind that what is written on Wikipedia isn't always true.
zh: 你需要记住维基百科上写的东西并不总是真的。

zh: 我忘记了。兰开斯特家族的族徽是红玫瑰还是白玫瑰？

en: After the war, the Netherlands was the country that executed and tortured the most Japanese, though some of them were innocent.
zh: 战争结束后，荷兰是处决和折磨日本人最多的国家，尽管他们中的一些人是无辜的。

en: The EU's unity is gradually becoming shakier.
zh: 欧盟的团结正逐渐变得动摇。

en: Kindly finish up the content of brochure hurriedly.
zh: 请尽快完成宣传册的内容。

en: They say that Firefox is downloaded over 8 million times a day.
zh: 据说Firefox每天被下载超过800万次。

en: People have time upon time faced 'a war that must not be lost'.
zh: 人们一次又一次地面对“一场不能输的战争”。

en: Barack Obama is aiming for an international ban on nuclear weapons, but is not against them in all wars.
zh: 贝拉克·奥巴马的目标是国际禁止核武器，但并不反对在所有战争中使用它们。

en: I make sure not to cross this street, even if I am in a hurry.
zh: 我确保不穿过这条街，即使我很着急。

en: The bus just had to be delayed when I'm in a hurry.
zh: 我着急的时候，公共汽车偏偏要晚点。

en: That sort of thing can happen when you're in a hurry.
zh: 当你着急的时候，那种事情可能会发生。

en: That kind of thing can happen when you're in a hurry.
zh: 当你着急的时候，那种事情可能会发生。

en: We're looking forward to the holidays.
zh: 我们期待着假期。

en: Right now, I'm choosing some suitable clothes to wear during the vacation.
zh: 现在，我正在挑选一些适合在假期穿的衣服。

en: If we took a rest, our moods would certainly feel refreshed.
zh: 如果我们休息一下，我们的心情肯定会感到焕然一新。

en: During the intermission, Takashi and Harumi had a drink at the theater bar.
zh: 幕间休息时，隆和晴美在剧院酒吧喝了一杯。

en: Let's take a break and drink some tea.
zh: 我们休息一下，喝点茶吧。

zh: 我们休息一下喝点茶吧。

en: Let's take a tea break.
zh: 我们休息一下喝点茶吧。

en: Over the holidays, I spent days doing nothing.
zh: 假期里，我整天无所事事。

en: On my days off, I read the entire works of Milton.
zh: 休息的时候，我会读弥尔顿的全集。

en: I read the entire works of Milton over the holiday.
zh: 假期里我读了弥尔顿的全集。

en: I read the entire works of Milton during my vacation.
zh: 休假期间我读了弥尔顿的全集。

en: The number of students who use their holidays to travel abroad is increasing.
zh: 利用假期出国旅游的学生人数正在增加。

en: Bernard Kouchner, who established Medecins Sans Frontieres, did not oppose the Iraq war.
zh: 创建了无国界医生的贝尔纳·库什内并不反对伊拉克战争。

en: Presidential candidate Obama's economics team seems to be made up of distinguished neoliberals.
zh: 总统候选人奥巴马的经济团队似乎是由杰出的新自由主义者组成的。

en: Kouchner, the French Minister for Foreign Affairs, advocated the G14 group.
zh: 法国外交部长库什内提倡G14集团。

en: Do you want to rest?
zh: 你想休息吗？

en: I really want to see Kumiko.
zh: 我真想见久美子。

en: I really want to meet Kumiko.
zh: 我真的很想和久美子见面。

en: I haven't seen you for a long time.
zh: 好久不见了。

en: I wonder if Mr. Oka will teach English.
zh: 不知道冈老师会不会教英语。

en: A white building is in sight at the foot of the hill.
zh: 在山脚下可以看到一座白色的建筑物。

en: The wind blew even harder when we reached the top of the hill.
zh: 当我们到达山顶时，风刮得更大了。

en: The house standing on the hill is very old.
zh: 山上的那栋房子很旧了。

en: His house could be seen from the top of the hill.
zh: 从山顶可以看到他的房子。

en: After my leg heals, I'll be able to move around again.
zh: 等我的腿好了，我又能到处走动了。

en: All the guests have gone.
zh: 客人都走了。

en: All the guests have gone home.
zh: 客人都回家了。

en: The customer is always right.
zh: 顾客永远是对的。

en: Give me one millet dumpling, please.
zh: 请给我一个黄米面团子。

en: I've lost a filling.
zh: 我的补牙掉了。

en: As I entered the tearoom I found two young men watching a wrestling match on television.
zh: 当我走进茶馆时，我发现两个年轻人在看电视上的摔跤比赛。

zh: 当我走进咖啡馆时，我发现两个年轻人在看电视上的摔跤比赛。

en: As I entered the coffee bar, I found two young men watching a wrestling match on television.
zh: 当我走进咖啡吧时，我发现两个年轻人在看电视上的摔跤比赛。

zh: 我走进咖啡店时，发现有两个年轻人在看电视上的摔跤比赛。

zh: 我走进咖啡店时，有两个年轻人在看电视上的摔跤比赛。

en: Smoking or nonsmoking?
zh: 吸烟区还是非吸烟区？

en: You should give up smoking since it's unhealthy.
zh: 你应该戒烟，因为吸烟不健康。

en: Smoking is now prohibited on all domestic flights.
zh: 现在所有国内航班都禁止吸烟。

en: Mr. Yoshida never breaks his promise.
zh: 吉田先生从不违背诺言。

zh: 吉田先生对他的孩子太严厉了。

en: I have a reservation, my name is Kaori Yoshikawa. Here's my confirmation card.
zh: 我有一个预订，我的名字是吉川香织。这是我的确认卡。

en: Chances are the bill will be rejected.

zh: 我的姐夫/妹夫/小舅子/大伯子很容易因为小事发脾气。

zh: 其中一个问题是我会成为什么样的人。

zh: 在霍皮语中，有一些关于拟声表达的有趣的例子。

zh: 工程师们试图利用自然，而不是试图理解自然。

zh: 由于技术创新，工厂的最大产量翻了一番。

en: We must be able to differentiate between objects and situations.
zh: 我们必须能够区分物体和情况。

en: We're anxious about her health.
zh: 我们很担心她的健康。

en: We can't tell her and her younger sister apart.
zh: 我们分不清她和她妹妹。

en: We cannot distinguish her and her younger sister.
zh: 我们无法区分她和她妹妹。

en: We can depend on her to help us.
zh: 我们可以依靠她来帮助我们。

en: We have to save him immediately.
zh: 我们必须立即救他。

en: We got some special evidence that proves that he is guilty.
zh: 我们得到了一些特殊的证据，证明他有罪。

en: We were afraid we might hurt his feelings.
zh: 我们害怕可能会伤害他的感情。

en: We expect a lot from him.
zh: 我们对他期望很高。

en: We have the great responsibility to see that he succeeds on the entrance exam.
zh: 我们有重大的责任，要确保他通过入学考试。

en: We couldn't help but think that he was dead.
zh: 我们禁不住认为他已经死了。

en: We galloped our horses over the hill.
zh: 我们策马飞奔过山丘。

en: We work every day but Sunday.
zh: 我们每天都工作，除了星期天。

en: We work every day except Sunday.
zh: 我们每天都工作，除了星期天。

en: We work daily.
zh: 我们每天工作。

en: We're confronted with a difficult situation.
zh: 我们面临着一个困难的局面。

en: We're faced with the choice between resistance and slavery.
zh: 我们面临着抵抗和奴役之间的选择。

en: We are faced with the alternatives of resistance or slavery.
zh: 我们面临着抵抗或奴役的选择。

en: We have to overcome many difficulties.
zh: 我们必须克服许多困难。

en: We eat so that we may live.
zh: 我们为了生存而吃饭。

en: We eat so we may live.
zh: 我们为了生存而吃饭。

en: We have to move very carefully.
zh: 我们必须非常小心地行动。

en: We really enjoyed ourselves.
zh: 我们玩得很开心。

en: We enjoyed ourselves to our hearts' content.
zh: 我们玩得非常尽兴。

en: We have to postpone our departure.
zh: 我们不得不推迟我们的出发。

en: We can't avoid putting off our departure.
zh: 我们无法避免推迟我们的出发。

en: We can't avoid postponing our departure.
zh: 我们无法避免推迟我们的出发。

en: We consider public libraries a legitimate citizen's right.
zh: 我们认为公共图书馆是公民的合法权利。

en: We must obey the traffic regulations.
zh: 我们必须遵守交通规则。

en: We learn a lot from experience.
zh: 我们从经验中学到很多。

en: We learn much from experience.
zh: 我们从经验中学到很多。

en: We are attracted to your personality.
zh: 我们被你的个性所吸引。

en: We are charmed by your individuality.
zh: 我们被你的个性所吸引。

en: We are sick of the tired old jokes the teacher keeps making.
zh: 我们厌倦了老师一直讲的那些老掉牙的笑话。

en: We're influenced by our environment.
zh: 我们受到环境的影响。

en: We all thought it strange that she had ditched such a pleasant guy.
zh: 她甩了这么好的一个男人，我们都觉得很奇怪。

en: We are wishing from the bottoms of our hearts, that he and everyone passes the admission examination.
zh: 我们衷心祝愿他和大家都能通过入学考试。

en: We are never as happy or as unhappy as we imagine.
zh: 我们永远不会像我们想象的那么快乐或那么不快乐。

en: We must prepare so that we will regret nothing.
zh: 我们必须做好准备，这样我们才不会后悔。

en: We did not help him, so he made it by himself.
zh: 我们没有帮助他，所以他靠自己成功了。

en: We went together to Laramie, but then we split up.
zh: 我们一起去了拉勒米，但后来我们分手了。

en: Due to circumstances beyond our control, we had to postpone the meeting.
zh: 由于我们无法控制的情况，我们不得不推迟会议。

en: We can't follow your plan any longer.
zh: 我们不能再按照你的计划进行了。

en: We have to do our best.
zh: 我们必须尽力而为。

en: We'll get through the jungle somehow.
zh: 我们总会以某种方式穿过丛林的。

en: We finally reached the top of Mt. Fuji.
zh: 我们终于到达了富士山顶。

en: We were finally able to settle the matter.
zh: 我们终于能够解决这个问题了。

en: We tend to think that most dogs bite.
zh: 我们倾向于认为大多数狗都会咬人。

en: We had no choice but to put up with it.
zh: 我们别无选择，只能忍受它。

en: The only thing we could do was to bear with it.
zh: 我们唯一能做的就是忍受它。

en: We had no choice except to put up with it.
zh: 我们别无选择，只能忍受它。

en: We'll discuss the problem with them.
zh: 我们将与他们讨论这个问题。

en: We're liable for the damage.
zh: 我们对损害负有责任。

en: We weren't prepared for the assault.
zh: 我们没有为这次袭击做好准备。

en: We camped on the side of the lake.
zh: 我们在湖边露营。

en: We talked the plan over with him.
zh: 我们和他讨论了这项计划。

en: We talked about the plan with him.
zh: 我们和他谈论了这项计划。

en: We discussed the plan with him.
zh: 我们和他讨论了这项计划。

en: We elected Mr. Jordan chairman.
zh: 我们选举乔丹先生为主席。
